main event: There were multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in Stillwater, Oklahoma on July 6 and 7, 1953. The objects were described as elliptical-shaped white lights, which exhibited unusual behavior and characteristics such as pulsating light and irregular movement.
interesting points: One sighting involved two elliptical-shaped white lights observed to move in an irregular arc from northeast to southwest, silently and glowing, with pulsating light lasting approximately 30 minutes.
Another witness described an object with bright lights moving farther apart until disappearing, with no sound and of an unusual shape that did not resemble an airplane.

A report mentioned the observation of two objects that appeared to have a connection between them, moving up and down in a vertical plane and gyrating in a way that the blinking light was not always visible.
An investigation concluded that a reported dead animal, initially claimed to be associated with the UFO sighting, was ultimately identified as a monkey without its tail.
witnesses: Civilian and Air Force pilot observers
